Reviews.Title: “Hotel was just ok.....shuttle to parks was a ride from hell!”
Reviews.Author: beachluvr0881
Reviews.Content: We checked in to what I booked a room with two double beds and there was only one.....the office staff didnt offer to switch us.....our electronic door didnt lock....was afraid to leave the room...had to call staff they told me they would have it looked it during the day! Got up early to eat breakfast at their advertised hot buffet breakfast to find out that they dont open tll 8:30 am....the shuttle leaves at 7:15 am! The shuttle ride absolutely STUNK! I question if the driver had a CDL!! The bus was overloaded coming home and he almost hit a car and caused us all to hang on....he kept slamming on his brakes ....hence the smell of brakes when he arrived to pick us up in the am. I pointed out to driver that his bus smelled like brakes....he said he knew! That night we had a different bus!! We never used the shuttle again....7:15 am pick up and we didnt get to the park till 10:00 am! Other than the shuttle, the room wasnt too bad at all...was clean....just not enuf towels...they give one per person!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but terrible shuttle bus to Disney”
Reviews.Author: NewWalkers
Reviews.Content: This is an inexpensive hotel so dont stay here expecting 5 star luxury. However if your just looking for a place to get your head down when your not busy at the many parks, than this is the place for you. The rooms are kept very clean by the maid service and they will work around you, so they will always come back later if your not quite ready for them. The pool is clean and not too crowded. Our room did need a little work as one of the sockets was hanging off the wall, but generally a pleasant place to be. The internet was pretty fast and its free! You do get a full sized fridge which is so handy. Our only real problem with the place was the bus that takes you to Disney from the hotel. It was always well too overcrowded (i mean packed in like sardines), do not use this bus if you have kids. It will take over an hour to reach Disney as it goes via all the other hotels. The return trip bus is also awful as there were always more people waiting than the bus could take, if you didnt make it on the first one than you had to wait an hour and a half for the next one. Because of this arguments between commuters and the bus drivers would happen, making an already unpleasant situation unbearable. I REPEAT DO NOT USE THIS SHUTTLE IF YOU HAVE KIDS!. On a brighter note there is a Steak N Shake right next to the hotel which do the best burgers in Orlando in our opinion. Walmart is also just across the road (so handy). Overall we do reccomend this hotel but not the shuttle bus.

Reviews.Title: “Pay the extra few dollars”
Reviews.Author: Blitzpacker
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for a very fair price. It is clean - bedding, towels, showers, smells, pool area and grounds. The towels are small, but you can ask for more. The pool is spotless and hardly used. Disney is a 10 minute drive from here and there is a bus stop out front if you want to take the bus. Hotel also offers an early morning shuttle. The people are friendly and the cleaning staff are great! We had spent our first night in a cheaper hotel ($5/night less expensive) and it was horrible compared to this. Also, they have wi-fi (internet) and you are in walking distance to food - Steak and Shake is on the property. Walmart is across the road (one block up). Huge flea market right beside. The rooms have a pull-out couch, blowdryer, iron, fridge and a microwave. Only thing we disliked is the plastic undersheet on the bed; we understand the importance of it, but it makes for an uncomfortable sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean, Inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: amcnair
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, quiet and pleasant. Furnishings and linens were as expected for an inexpensive hotel, but everything was clean, neat and well taken care of. The shuttle service to Disney only runs once a day, which made it worthless for our needs. Didn't use the pool, but it looked clean and well-maintained. Hotel was a little tricky to find, tucked in behind a Steak & Shake. Overall, very nice for the price.

Reviews.Title: “It's cheap, it's a room and then there were cockroaches!!”
Reviews.Author: KevinZahrte
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to stay somewhere other than at a Disney resort there are a lot of inexpensive options in the Orlando/Kissimmee area. However, I think you get what you pay for, especially in the Disney World area. For $45 a night we got a dated motel with no amenities such as a fridge or microwave and basics like a heated pool. Overall it is an ok place to stay BUT we had cockroaches in our room both big and small, alive and dead. There weren't a lot of them but the handful we found did not make my wife and daughter feel very welcome or sleep very sound. If you are taking a trip on a budget, there are many motel choices and this won't be on our list of places to stay at if we ever return to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy dirty and NASTY”
Reviews.Author: Ana B
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed at this hotel last April and let me tell you it was absolutly disgusting and dirty.... The first room we got was dirrrrrtyyyy!! Walls had mold... Doors were rusty...bed and sheets were jet black and dusty.... carpet floor was just filthy jet black socks were the results.....Shower was nasty with stains... We complained and got a second room ...the SAME THING... DO NOT STAY there if you are planning a family vacation. We finally gave up after hours of staying at the hotel and went to a much better resort. I was trying trying to get hold of the manager and he would't get to the hotel untill NOON...and that was NO ONE to help me to get my refund that's how nasty that hotel is...and seriously needs to be shut down...We finally got hold of the manager a day later.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Darren R
Reviews.Content: Like most people, we were there for WDW and Universal. Don't get me wrong, instead of getting a taxi from the Greyhound terminal we chose to walk (which took a hell of a long time in scorching heat and backpacks) so our expectations and desires were rising with each step...and the hotel lived up to all expectations. A clean bed and a working shower is all we required but what we got was a phenomenally clean room - and i mean each day, not just upon arrival - pleasant staff, useful free internet, a great bath and shower and a decent tv. Your not here for fancy stuff, so why complain if the view is rubbish, or the food is basic? Your hardly gonna be there. Free shuttle at 7am and again at 9 for Universal, and completely hassle free. If we come back, we would definitely come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a lot of a value...far from WDW, dirty rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ohhector
Reviews.Content: I usually stay much closer to the WDW property...gone are the days where you could save a lot of money by staying further away. But since I was working at a location that was on Orange Blossom Dr, I figured I'd try a new hotel. Location wise, the area is not too bad, most of it has been redeveloped...that is, excluding the actual property the hotel is on. The pavement in the parking lot is all messed up, and the presentation is dirty. The rooms themselves are VERY old, furniture has a lot of chips and wear. The worst part was how dirty the carpet was. I could feel the dirt as I walked around barefoot, and my socks turned black after a few hours of walking around. Also, the curtains do a very poor job of blocking out light, which is a huge issue if you stay facing the courtyard, which has these intense orange lights on all night. The distance to the parks also makes this a bad value...US 192 is one of those roads where you will catch EVERY SINGLE TRAFFIC LIGHT. It took me at least 10-15 minutes to reach I-4 from here, and this was at night with no traffic. Not a terrible hotel, but it's old, dirty, and really not a good value. They also charge a mandatory "service fee" for use of park shuttles and internet computers.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all for less than $50 night!”
Reviews.Author: Sc0tt1230
Reviews.Content: Ok don't expect any 5* luxury... But this hotel is definitely good for the price. To be honest I had no complaints at all during the 4 nights stay last december 2011. Ok this hotel is a little outdated like 99% of the hotels on Highway 192, but the room was clean, the shower was hot and had a good pressure and the bed was good, just like an average hotel bed. The only thing that was a little disappointing was that the supply of fresh towels: only two small fresh towels a day. But like I said not bad at all for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: Mum-luvs_to_travel
Reviews.Content: We actually were surprised by the hotel once we got there as the room was cleaner than we expected or as indicated by the walk to the room. There were a couple of disappointments but nothing one might not expect for $28 a night. Housekeeping did a great job and it appeared our room was fumigated before we got there so there were not bugs of any sort to be found. The room was very damp though, and we learned in a hurry to put the heat on for a couple of hours before bed and first thing in the morning. We did try and use the safe - with no luck. In fact, we locked some papers in there that we couldn't get out, but they weren't all that important so we had no problem waiting for maintenance to get them out. Never did make it work but nothing went missing from our room so I wasn't really worried about it. The shuttle service is terrible as indicated in past reviews. But you can buy a day pass on the bus for $4.50 which runs every 30 minutes from 6am to almost 11. No waits, not so crowded, you can come and go as you want and straight to the hotel. Bus stop is just half a block from the hotel. Our stay was much more enjoyable once we discovered the bus :)

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, just ok”
Reviews.Author: Danielle_saopaulo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just ok. Nothing too bad to say and nothing good. The service is just what they propose for the price you pay. The only thing that was really bad was the shuttle to the parks that run always too full, with awful drivers and goes in times not very good (like, you arrive at universal at 11am). It has an wal mart in front, the rooms are old but not so bad, the pool seemed ok, NO BREAKFAST, cool people in the front desk and in maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Untrustworthy”
Reviews.Author: 219Michelle
Reviews.Content: Please make sure you make arrangements to purchase Disney tickets before arriving. I called a few weeks before my visit and the person who answered the phone at the hotel told me that they sell the Disney tickets at the hotel. He said I could "purchase" them once I arrived. When we arrived there on Christmas eve we were informed that in order to purchase the tickets we needed to sign up for a tour of a resort. Needless to say we were pissed! We had driven all day and now we had to find tickets at the last minute for the park on Christamas day. They directed us to their computers in the middle of the hallway and told us to buy them online or we could purchase them at the local walmart. There were people using the computers so we headed to the very crowded walmart nearby and stood in line to buy tickets for the park. When I called the desk to complain about the situation they tried to pretend that they didn't know anything. The person on the phone said that the people who sell the tickets inside their hotel is not affiliated with the hotel. Seriously! You don't know anything about the lies that they are telling your guests? I let him know that it's not a good idea to tell people that they offer discounted tickets unless they tell them upfront what they have to sign up for a time share demo. I've purchased tickets from the Disney website on several occasions and I would have done it again if they had been honest about it in the first place. The game room is 3 very old video games with a few half empty snack machines that will take your money. The good thing about this hotel is that the rooms are clean and it's cheap. Worth the price and I wouldn't have paid any more. If you only need a place to sleep then it's fine. I just couldn't get pass the lies.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lbrizzle
Reviews.Content: I came to stay here for one night while preparing to leave Kissimmee, Fl. First the lobby was fairly clean to give you the impression that the rooms are the same. Now...they charge an extra $5 for shuttle to attractions and internet kiosks in the lobby. YOU WILL PAY THIS even if you have no plans of using them. The elevator smelled like death and walking to your room looked like I was walking the Green Mile. The pool looks desease ridden. The room smelled wet and reeked of mildew. The bed was uncomfortable. THERE WAS NOOO HOT WATER!!! They told me I had to run the water for about an hour. After the hour, still with no hot water, I was fed up and wanted my money back and to leave. They have a 15 min refund policy, but had me watching the water for an hour!!! After arguing and bugging for another hour, the owner finally gave me a refund. The most I would pay for this place is $10 for the night. HORRIBLE PLACE

Reviews.Title: “Great last minute hotel”
Reviews.Author: paddickp
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at 2 weeks notice, we knew where this hotel was so that suited us. There is a super Wal-Mart opposite as well as a crazy golf, there is a steak & shake in front of the hotel. The hotel its self was great for the money £220 for 2 weeks but there is a resort fee of about £40 this is for free transport to the parks (we never used it so cant comment) & the safe. The rooms are very tidy & clean if a little dated pool very nice as we spent most of our time there, its the same as most hotels in americia relay we chose this hotel because we could of paid anything up to an extra £400 & stayed in lake buena vista but then we would have less spending money But well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “great bargain, but watch for extra fees”
Reviews.Author: RMM60
Reviews.Content: Hotel definately appears somewhat dilapated but the rooms are clean and comfortable. Stayed twice - 1 room had a microfridge and the other did not. Don't expect much in the way of amenities but they have all of the essentials and everything worked. Great deal for the money, but be aware they will tack on about 4.80 per day, even with a prepaid non-refundable rate. No breakfast but plenty of restaurants in the area. Several other hotels in the area also tack on extra fees. Pool was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “watch out for the extra fees.”
Reviews.Author: eddlt
Reviews.Content: they hit me with a 4.50 per day fee. no choice! it was for transport to disney. problem was that they left at 7am and I got up at 8am. total waste of my money. this added cost could be paid toward a better quality room for the same price. ask about the extra fees before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: Pradeep N
Reviews.Content: The hotel can be a 2 star if u r visiting disney, universal studios, or seaworld right place to stay, we ony used it between 9pm to 9am simply to sleep nice location with restaurants, walmart and shopping around, 30 mins to all the attractions, NASA is around an hour, can use the hotel bus to goto the parks. you get what you pay for not to expect more...

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is a dump”
Reviews.Author: lparmenter
Reviews.Content: This hotel was arranged for us as a package by Southwest Airlines through a travel agent. Southwest obviously need sto check out their hotels before booking people. This hotel looks nothing like the pictures on the website. It is run down and dirty. The minute we drove in the dilipadated parking lot, we knew it was a dump. The lobby area floors were dirty, the furniture in the lobby run down. The public bathrooms had not been cleaned in days. Rubbish overflowing in the wastebaskets, dirty toilets, scuff marks on the walls. The pool area had four lounge chairs. We got their early and the hotel clerk, chewing her gum, said in an unpleasant manner, you cant check in until 400 p.m. We did not even check in. We went and paid additonal money to stay at another hotel, Baymont Inn on the same street. Baymont Inn was clean and the clerk was pleasant and more than happy to let us check in early.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Give it a try and see for yourself!”
Reviews.Author: Bama89
Reviews.Content: Was a bit worried after reading some of the reviews on this page however booked anyways due the VERY low rate. Only paid $29.99 plus a $4.50 resort fee which includes access to their computers, shuttle to Disney/Universal, and in-room safe. Didnt use any of those but still felt the rate was very good! The room was in the second building and had a view of the pool. This is a family hotel and there were always kids in the pool, so if you don't like noise you may not want to be near it. The pool looked clean and was a good size. Did not use it as we were in the parks all day. Distance to the Disney was about 15-20 min depending on traffic, Universal was a bit further 20-30 min. Housekeeping was great. There was three of us, on the first day we were only given 2 towels, cups however after that the housekeeper gave enough for all three without being told. Guess she looked at the reservation. Coffee was given every day, beds made, trashed took, etc. Rooms are basic but are comfortable and great after a long day at the parks. Check in/Check out was a little long but wasnt anything too bad. So if you are looking for a good room at a low rate stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! A+”
Reviews.Author: dragonlvr
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel! The room was very clean and very comfortable! Air conditioner worked great and so did the shower and TV. They have vending machines and computers with internet access in the lobby which was very helpful. Also the rooms have free wiifi that worked great. The best part was that the in-room safe was a nice size and actually fit my laptop plus a couple other things! The drive to Disney World and Universal Studios was about 20 minutes which isn't too bad. They also offer a shuttle service to the parks which i did not take. We didn't eat inside the restaurant but we did order food from them a couple of the days and the food was very good and reasonable priced. Just be careful of the stray cats in the area, they are incredible friendly and will stalk you if you talk to them, so if you hear a "meow" behind you just keep walking :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if on a budget - shuttle bus was a long commute to Disney/Universal”
Reviews.Author: naomi83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 10 nights having booked a 5 day Disney pass and a 4 day Universal Pass. We initially requested a room with a fridge/microwave as when booking it was not possible to specifically book this. However when checking back on the HOJO website nearer the time of arrival they had updated their website to make it explicit which rooms have a fridge and microwave and they were $5 more than what we had paid. When we checked in we were asked to pay the extra $5 to upgrade to a room with a fridge and microwave but we were expecting this and felt it was worth it due to having such a long stay. There is also a resort fee of $4.82 a night but they do clearly state this on the website so again we were prepared for this extra charge. Despite these ‘extras’ we still felt our room was good value at just under $40 a night after the resort fee and tax. Our room was on the ground floor and built for disabled guests so was larger than average. As well as the fridge and microwave there was also a tea and coffee maker with tea and coffee replenished daily. As well as a large bed, TV, wardrobe and dresser there was a table and chairs which was good when we had meals in the room. Overall we felt the room was homely which was perfect for our longer stay. The room was cleaned daily, and hotel staff all friendly and helpful, even letting me make a call to my bank in the UK when I lost a bank card during my stay. Being so close to Walmart and having a fridge and microwave in the room was a huge bonus for us as we saved us so much money being able to make our own breakfast/dinner. Plus we bought a cheap cool pack to take packed lunches/snacks/drinks to the parks each day which I would estimate saved us in excess of $200!! Some days we literally spent nothing in the parks - generally spending $10 on a drink or an ice cream and that was it! The Steak and Shake outside the hotel and Ciccis pizza buffet which is a 15 min walk were also great budget meals choices after a long day at the parks. To sum up: if you have a car then this hotel is great, if you are only going to use the shuttle bus for Disney this hotel is great, if you are going to use the shuttle bus for Universal and only have a 2 day park ticket perhaps look elsewhere (see shuttle bus explanation below). Shuttle bus info: This was the only negative to our stay as the commute to/from Disney/Universal was an hour journey and a limited service. Being the furthest hotel away from Disney and Universal means you are first on the shuttle run so despite getting picked up at 7.30am (the only morning pick up) you do not reach Disney until 8.30am (Epcot) as you go round at least 10 other hotels picking guests up. On the way back it leaves Magic Kingdom at 8.45pm or 10.15pm and again you are the last drop off! There was also a 12.30pm service to Epcot but we never used this. The Universal bus is scheduled to depart the hotel at 8.40am but as it uses the same bus as goes to Disney it NEVER picked us up until 9am so I don’t know why the hotel doesn’t just change the time to 9am pick up! We would typically arrive at Universal after 10am. The Univeral bus picks up from the park at 7.15pm and was generally on time. Using the shuttle we got to the Disney parks each day usually before the parks opening at 9am as there is very efficient Disney transport to all parks from Epcot which you could jump straight on. Plus there is the #56 Lynx bus which goes from US192 – right outside the hotel to Magic Kingdom and back from 4am – 10.58pm which we generally used to come back from Disney if we didn’t want to stay until 8.45pm. It was $2 a journey. You could use it to go to Disney if you wanted to get there earlier/later too. The Universal bus was not ideal if you only had a 2 day ticket there as I think you would struggle to do all you wanted to do in the parks in 1 or 2 days as the bus times would cut your day short by 3 hours of the park opening times. We didn’t arrive until at least 10am and left at 7pm whereas the park opens at 9am and closes at 9pm. Taxis to/from Universal were $40 each way from the hotel and there is no easy bus commute. However, it would be worth checking the above times with the hotel before booking as there may be a better service during summer season as the hotel was operating the May schedule (despite it being June).

Reviews.Title: “You could do better in the area”
Reviews.Author: Neetlebug
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid, we were happy with what we got, but we did get the impression we could have been in a more convenient location, especially to get to the parks. It offers free shuttles to the parks - these only run once a morning and twice late in the evening. And they service all the hotels in the area - Super 8, Red Roof Inn, Quality Inn etc. HJ Tropical Palms in the furthest on the route so you leave first thing in the morning and arrive home last in the evening which makes for very long days! It is on the Lynx route though with a bus from the Magic kindgom to a stop right across the street for only $2 so that is a viable alternative if you want to leave the parks early than 8:45pm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the Money”
Reviews.Author: nhlady59
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay with young children, or on a budget. The location was good, it was quiet and clean. The staff also went out of their way to make sure we were happy.

Reviews.Title: “Spend a few extra dollars and go some where else”
Reviews.Author: tohut
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms are in much need of repair. Half the lights didnt work, tv remote didnt work and couldnt get a new one. Plus they charged extra fees for stuff that i did not sign for. Currently fighting to get my money back. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND TO ANYONE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: Tboy18
Reviews.Content: We all enjoyed our stay here. The staff was excellent hats off to Steve, Gary, Ti, and the great looking Housekeeping staff. They treated us all like VIPS. No complaints, no bad experience would stay here again. Matter's as fact we are planning to stay again in 2012. God Bless you all.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: IRODRIGUEZMOLINA
Reviews.Content: It was a nightmare for us. We paid everything and the last night when we return to the hotel they blocked my room. When they accepted that was a mistake...I checked the room and they didn't put towells I called so many time to front desk asking for towels and they took a long time before they provide us the towels. It was the most terrible stay that I never had before in any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Other hotels in the area look much better”
Reviews.Author: veronica_1963
Reviews.Content: We had a difficult time locating the hotel and when we did were very disappointed at the filthy grounds. The entire property is a mess, with storage of building materials and trash anywhere it could be stored. There is no "good" view from the low quality room with horrible mattresses. The hotel is located close to everything you'd want as want and that was terrific. There are other hotels in the area that are beautiful with comparable prices! Check the "local" hotels out when you get there between "Markers 12 and 9". Hotels all seemed to have vacancies and I would recommend that you just arrive and find a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, very clean hotel with courteous helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: lw275
Reviews.Content: I stayed in your hotel last year for 2 weeks, and had such a good time, met many new friends and ejoyed the facilities so much I came back for 4 weeks this year. I plan on coming back next year for another 4 weeks. The hotel is very clean and well cared for and the staff are really helpful at all times. Any issues are addressed promptly and resolved. Your location is great to get to all the destinations any family could choose and your rates are excellent for the value received. Thank you for making my stay a wonderful respite from the cold Canadian winter. See you next year!!! Linda Ward

Reviews.Title: “The staff, rooms, and service were excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Kopai
Reviews.Content: The location, and staff at the hotel were very accomodating every year that I have stayed at the HoJo Tropical Pines. The rooms were very clean and the grounds, pool area had a nice atmosphere. The location to all the attractions, restaurants, and stores were close by. I recommend this hotel highly and attend to return next year for a 3 month stay. It was like being home.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: jcopel05
Reviews.Content: I booked a weeks stay online thru Southwest.com.I requested a downstairs room since i am disabled.Also on the web site it stated that rooms came with micro & fridge.When I arrived late night after a long drive was told that only room available was on 3rd floor.I explained to desk clerk that there was no way i would be able to walk up stairs.While i don't think he really made an effort finding me another room,he did have someone take my baggage up for me and there was an elevator,which made it somewhat easier,although the room was at the end of a very long corridor.It was only after i unpacked my bags that i realized that there was not a micro or fridge.I tried calling down to front desk, but there was no answer.After about 30 minutes, i finally spoke with Gary,who stated that micro'fridge would be additional charge and since i would be there 4 days it would be $37.50,which i declined.After checking back online,it did state the "most" rooms come with a micro/fridge. Desk clerk told me to check with the manager in the morning about changing rooms.Well, when i inquired at the front desk the next day, the young lady on duty at the time already knew about my situation and already had reserved a room for me on the 1st lever with parking right outside the door and micro/fridge at no additional cost. She sent someone to retrieve my luggage from the old room,and since the new room wasn't ready, she assured me that she would put my belongins in her office and move it once the room was ready,since i couldn't wait because of a dr's appt that morning. I returned that evening only to find that my luggage was not in the new room, and again Gary didn't know anything about this until i told him and after 30 minutes, my luggage was sent to the new room.Overall, this stay was just ok, i would stay again.The only other issue is the location,it's difficult getting to property since it is situated far back from the main road.A big plus is that there is a restuarant located on the premise that has room service at no additional cost.I didn't eat there so i can't comment on the food,but the prices are very reasonable although the hours of operation are confusing.

Reviews.Title: “better than I supposed”
Reviews.Author: wenluosheng
Reviews.Content: Before I arrived at the hotel, I supposed that it isn't good one, especially its transportation. Until I finished my seven travel, I firmly say, it is so far better than that I supposed and I paid. It is close to Wal-Mart, and the microwave and fridge in my room are available. The shuttle for Disney resorts is convenient. The swimming pool and many trees make the hotel better. If you wander around, you can find a plea market at hand, in which you could buy some cheap items. I specially thank Ms Song, the boss of hotel. She is so friendly and help us. Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible and dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: natasha50
Reviews.Content: They did charge us an extra $5 (they call it "resort fee") This place didn't look like a resort at all. When we showed them prepaid reservation (in Spanish),in which was stated that we do not have to pay anything else, they told us that no one speaks Spanish there. I came down 5 min later to ask for another room, the same clerk at reservation desk was speaking Spanish to other guests. When I complained about stinky bathroom and dirty sheets, they offered another room, and it was just as stinky, and as dirty as the previous room. The third room turned out to be (no surprise there) stinky and dirty too. I also, ended up going to walmart, across the street and buying new sheets and towels. This was my first and my last time I stayed at Howard Johnson. And I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE CHEATERS”
Reviews.Author: Ronnen
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation for 1 night in August for $28+tax including free breakfast, free internet, etc. When we arrived at the hotel they told us we must add about $5 to the price for using the safe, the free internet and the shuttle to WDW. I said that the internet should be free, the safe is included in the room (as written in my receipt) and we don't need the shuttle, but they say these $5 fee is mandatory. Further more, they said there is no free breakfast in this hotel. I showed them my receipt where it is written "free breakfast", and they told me it is only the logo of Howard Johnson, and no free breakfast in this hotel. I kept sidcussing this problems with one who claimed to be the owner of this hotel, and when I told him they are cheaters, I was asked to leave the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Functional Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vickym27
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this hotel this year and it is a good hotel if visiting the Disney Parks. Set back from the busy 192 this hotel is quiet and comfortable. The rooms are spacious and clean although functional in nature. No breakfast is offered in the hotel and the restaurant is limited, However, there is a walmart supercentre across the street and the hotel has a microwave in the lobby for guests to use. There are also the usual chain restaurants (McDonald's, Cracker Barrell, Wafflehouse etc) along the 192 for breakfast. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel for visiting the Disney parks

Reviews.Title: “Staff was friendly but never again.”
Reviews.Author: Shrek30
Reviews.Content: We wanted a less expensive hotel for our weekend stay so we ended up here. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful so I was hoping the cleanliness of the rooms would match. No such luck. The chair in the room was really dirty and things were left in the room from the previous guests. The bathroom wasn't clean either. I ended up going to the walmart that was right down the street and purchasing new sheets, pillows, and lysol to spray everything down. My next stay I'll just spend the extra money to stay somewhere clean. But the staff was really friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Never again ..........”
Reviews.Author: starbucksluvver
Reviews.Content: We could not believe how tatty and grubby this hotel was. Howard Johnson's must have really dropped their standards over the years. We arrived to be told rudely by the front desk clerk that they had no record of our reservation (despite my paperwork clearly showing we had booked and paid for 4 nights), and that because we had not made the booking directly with Ho Jo (but instead through an internet site "Yeego") that we would have to go elsewhere. This was at almost midnight after a 5 hour delay and 8 hour flight from the UK. We insisted upon a room and that we would sort matters out the following day. We were given the key to a stinky and drab ground floor room besides rubbish bins and the main hotel air-conditioning unit. Thank goodness we were barely in the room as we were at Universal from early morning to late at night. I wouldn't let my children walk around with no shoes on and I dared not look under or behind the beds. We had to call the hotel on 3 occasions the following day from payphones at Universal to get our reservation sorted and even then the hotel never apologised for the mix-up or their rude and unhelpful reception staff. I would avoid this place like the plague. Plenty more acceptable properties in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “We left the first night”
Reviews.Author: xohockeygurl14xo
Reviews.Content: This was the most disgusting hotel I have ever been to in my life. Me and my boyfriend were there for my birthday and we love Howard Johnson hotels so we thought we would be good with this one but no TOTAL NIGHTMARE! He booked for 4 nights and we left after 2 hours of us being there and we got no refund!! Don't waste your time and don't waste the money. It was dirty, the room they put us in looked like no one had been there in years. The shower was horrible I wouldn't even let my dog in there

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rate, nice stay”
Reviews.Author: carol_tourist
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a place to lay your head after a long day at a business conference or even at the theme parks, this is the place to stay. I stayed in room 224, overlooking the pool. It was nice and clean. The housekeeper Veronica was really nice and friendly, as well as the handyman Ricardo. I also loved all the front desk people - Tee, Gary and the girls, whose names I don't remember. They were all very friendly and hospitable. I loved the fact that I had free Internet access. Breakfast was not included in the rate, but it was pretty reasonable, ranging from 0.99 to 4.99, depending on what you have. I didn't have breakfast there, though, but it was good to know I had that cheap option. I would stay there again without a doubt and totally recommend it to my friends. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for quiet and price.”
Reviews.Author: tocchet
Reviews.Content: i have been comming to this hotel for 7 years.the price is right,the rooms are clean,the staff are friendly.you get free shuttles to all the parks,large heated pool. close to walmart .steak n shake on the property. i have told friends and have come to this hotel with friends. i can't believe some of the bad comments some people have written. george lidstone . prince edward island canada.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for budget conscious”
Reviews.Author: dlion
Reviews.Content: Paid $28 per night (online), plus a compulsory $5 dollar per night resort fee at check-in, which covers wifi, safebox, and daily bus to parks and back. The hotel is in the center of Kissimmee, on the main highway. Disney is 10 min away, Seaworld is 15, Universal is 20. Busch Gardens is 90 mins west, and Space Center is 80 mins east. The rooms are clean and big. Housekeeping is done daily. Coin laundry is on site. Pool is big, and popular. Staff is mixed, some are friendly. Hotel has a resturant, but its poor. Lots of eats nearby. Walmart superstore is across the street. Mall is nearby. Flea market is next door. Walgreens, Ross, Burlintons, all close walk. 10-day stay was comfortable, and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “perfect value, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: irisKy
Reviews.Content: nice staff, clean rooms, quiet what more could u ask for

Reviews.Title: “I keep coming back for the value.”
Reviews.Author: ezgoinsunlvr
Reviews.Content: I get that this hotel is not everyone's ideal for luxury. If you are looking for luxury I suggest you go elsewhere. However, I usually find myself checking in here for a couple of nights every time I'm in the area. I find it comfortable, and because it is set so far back from the road, I find it quiet too. It is just far enough away from the parks to not seem too touristy, and yet is close enough to them that you can easily get to them from here. I usually check in for one night, with the idea that if I have a bad stay I can go elsewhere, but in four visits thus far to the Howard Johnson Inn Tropical Palms I have extended my stay every time.

Reviews.Title: “ok.., for the price”
Reviews.Author: nature_nutca
Reviews.Content: I booked directly with the hotel (could have gotten it cheaper on hotels.com). This hotel is a bit runned down, but we only needed a room for the night. We arrived in Florida early and was able to check in about noon (with no additional fee). We did not use the pool; but the kids appeared to be enjoying it. The room was ok...nothing special; but it did have a fridge and micro, and internet was free. I might stay here in the future, for one night.., but not for the duration of my trip. Was ok, nothing fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: dixiedogCanada
Reviews.Content: Just a short review. The price was right. The staff were friendly and knowledgable and very curtious. Nice big clean rooms. Big pool. Woulkd definitly reccomend this hotel to all my friends and enemies!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accommodations.................would definitely recommend.....”
Reviews.Author: LivingandLoving
Reviews.Content: Whilst looking for a place to stay in Kissimmee that was close to Medieval Times and US192 I came across this hotel. After reading some of the reviews I was hesitant to stay my entire stay at this hotel so I decided to only book 2 nights online and said I would look for another place once I got there. From we pulled up i knew I would be comfortable. The front desk personnel; Ti was very friendly, the hotel's decor was gorgeous with it's earth tone colors. I loved that it had computers right out of the lobby for easy access. Our room was overlooking the pool - the beds were comfortable (I could not wait it get in it at night), the room was clean, equipped with fridge, microwave, iron and ironing board. I loved the room so much that by the second day, I booked 2 more nights. I would definitely recommend it to others to stay.

Reviews.Title: “EXTREMELY SATISFIED”
Reviews.Author: DROPT
Reviews.Content: Great value. Comfortable room and bed. Friendly and accommodating staff. Would gladly stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget-Friendly Hotel. More than expected. Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Pear14
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything you would need and more for the price you pay. We stayed 5 nights with our two young children and paid $30 bucks a night! For the price, you get cable, up-to-date decor, free wi-fi, computer stations downstairs, iron, hairdryer, fridge, microwave, and nice service. The front desk was very helpful and friendly. My favorite part about this hotel is the location. It is walking distance to Wal-mart, Subway, Steak N Shake, McDonald's and more! My family was on a DIsney vacation and being with the economy, we were on a budget. So I booked this hotel for the price. I was a little skeptical before arriving, but it was a nice surprise to know we didn't get a truckers hotel. You get a little more than the price at this hotel. If you want the Four Seasons Hotels, pay Four Seasons price.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: mojodaso
Reviews.Content: Staff was really friendly, rooms well appointed, refrigerator and microwave in room was great. Would highly recommend them.

Reviews.Title: “Overall not a bad price”
Reviews.Author: traceym507
Reviews.Content: We went Walt Disney for 4 days and 3 nights got this through an internet site. Overall I did not think this was that bad especially for the price. I looked at it as atleast I got a place to sleep and that is it basically all we needed the room for is a place to sleep for the night. I did not run into any problems with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: kbanks
Reviews.Content: I must admit after reading some prior reviews I was a bit skeptical booking a room here. Wow, were we pleasantly surprised! The hotel is set back behind a Steak-N-Shake which makes it more quiet than directly on 192. It is an older property, hence a real Olympic size and separate kiddie pool with updated chaise/umbrella table chairs. Huge oak trees shade picnic tables set in a grassy area. The hotel has recently been renovated including bathrooms, mattresses etc. It is well kept and clean with both the housekeeping and maintenance staff right on top of things. Our room provided hair dryer, coffee maker, iron/ironing board, small fridge, microwave and in room safe (free). Also included was cable tv and free wifi. Guest laundry facilities are available. The lobby included several computers for free access, along with a small area containing games and vending machines. A free USA Today newspaper can be picked up there daily. A desk where tickets can be purchased along with information and coupons on things to do also shares the lobby. Light breakfast and lunch can be purchased on property. The prices are very reasonable and grabbing a bite there would be convenient before you board the free theme park shuttle (that’s right - free shuttle) (saving attraction parking fees). We found the location to be perfect for us. Medieval Times is a stone’s throw away. Disney is a straight shot down 192 about 12 miles. Two miniature golf courses (one across street) are also very close. A Kissimmee bus stop is located near the Steak N Shake. Don’t forget that free shuttle! There is a Super Walmart across the street (where we loaded up the fridge from). A fairly new Super Target, Dollar Tree ($1 flip flops!), Marshalls, etc. within five miles. Several restaurants, fast foods are easily accessible (all on 192). Our fave was the brand new Denny’s! I wrote as much detail as I could in this review to not only report on our hotel stay, but give future visitors information that may make their stay easier. This is not a luxury hotel but a great place to stay for those looking for a clean, safe, convenient accommodation. I might add that we paid less than $40 a night during our visit. A true bargain for the knowledgeable traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Hema_gvk
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean rooms with Microwave, Mini Fridge, Iron box and board, hair dryer. Close to Amusement Parks. We stayed for 3 nights and did not have any problem

Reviews.Title: “No problems here”
Reviews.Author: edpeck
Reviews.Content: Anytime you spend $35.00/night for a hotel don't expect too much. We stayed one night nothing special but it was clean and had a pool, next door to a flea market if you need anything. Located on 192 close to tons of eat joints, stake and shake out front.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: geheim
Reviews.Content: we just paid $29.95 a night (booked on triprewards), and since all the other cheap hotels in kissimmee had VERY bad reviews, I was quite sceptical. But the room was VERY clean, very nice, and the furniture looked new. We had a "deluxe" room, which means it came with micro and fridge, both were black and looked new also. This room was definitely worth $65 or more a night since it was so clean and new, but - as I said, we paid $29 a night. HOWEVER, they charge a "resort fee" of $4.50 PLUS TAX for EACH NIGHT. They also don't offer free breakfast, you have to pay for it, but you can eat at the hotel, which is nice. Walmart is right across the street, so you can purchase anything you might forgot at home without even using your car. the resort fee is for the shuttle service to the theme parks which we didn't use, in-room safe (which we didn't use), pool towel - THE POOL HAD NO WATER IN IT (but it was freezing cold out, so we wouldn't have gone swimming anyway) all in all: I paid only 35 bucks a night (including the resort fee) and I had a very clean, nicely decorated room with two double beds in it. So I am very pleased. I do want to mention, though, that I stayed at baymont inn last weekend (which is just a few hundred meters down the road) and there the price is the same but the rooms are A LOT bigger and all of them come with fridge and microwave and the beds are queen size, not full. So next time I might stay at baymont again. This weekend I didn't cause for some reason they were $50 a night. Last weekend they only wanted $32 a night. P.S. the staff was very friendly/polite

Reviews.Title: “Worste hotel i ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: OhioPat
Reviews.Content: AVOID IF YOu WoulD LIke TO LiVE Don't buy the breakfast I found a bug in the bathtub. Mysterious people walking around out of the doors

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy and Dirty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DSC83
Reviews.Content: My mother got a good deal on this hotel buy listening to a tour. (She paid $38 for a 4 night stay.) It's true you do get what you pay for. I didn't want to walk in this hotel based on how it looked from the outside. This hotel is way in the back sitting in a very trashy area. There is some sort of tool shed with trash, paint, wood, and plain out junk being used by the hotel. The elevators were so scary, I walked up and down the stairs with luggage in hand the entire time. Checking in was fast. We got into the room the carpet was dirty, the bathroom was plain out disgusting. The bathtub had a dirty ring around it, and there were strands of hair on top of the toilet. This room smelled so bad we asked to be switched to another room, which we were fast. In both rooms the decor was out dated. The room had a nice size T.V . The walls and doors of the hotel was paper thin. You could hear everything. During the night we heard loud children and adults running back and forth through the halls. Next door someone was playing extremely loud music for 5 minutes. I can't believe no one asked them to quiet down. The constant sounds of the heavy door slamming scared me to death. Someone's car alarm kept going on and off the out entire stay. It was a very unpleasant stay. One positive thing about this hotel was the computer access in the lobby. We did leave one day early.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: dtjwnbarr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with two young sons for 4 nights while we traveled to spring training games around the state. For $30 a night, plus a $4 resort fee, I didn't expect any extras, and I didn't get any. The room was old, but it was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. The only problems were that the water smelled a little funny and the cable connection, while not terrible, could have been better. All we needed was a place to sleep at night, and if that is all you need, this place is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Motel”
Reviews.Author: bobbydigi
Reviews.Content: Good motel for the price we paid ($30 + 4 something in resort fee) Got a double bed room with clean hot bathroom, but the water does smell a little. Carpet doesn't get vaccum everyday when we stayed there for a week. Wireless Internet was free but connections will drop after 10 min but you just have to reconnect. DO NOT TAKE Shuttle to Disney or Universal provided by the motel, we made a mistake of taking it and wasted 1.5 hours touring lots of motels even when the bus was full. Take City Lynx Bus #56 to go to Disney Magic Kingdom for $1.75 each way if you didn't rent a car. Location was hard to find, it's on 192 past marker 14 east. East of Walmart, look for the Steak n Shake and the motel is located behind it. Steak n Shake is a good place to grab a late bite.

Reviews.Title: “great for the price”
Reviews.Author: BorisKey
Reviews.Content: We went with recent Orbitz deal when they covered $150 if you book for 5 days, so it came up total with taxes $58 for 5 days. Also hotel charges you resort fee which is $4 per day, so we paid $80 for 5 days stay We read all these review after we booked it and we very scary to go there, but we live close to Orlando (3 hours drive) so we decided to give it a try and went there on Thanksgiving The room we got was in the front building on the first floor (4 doors to the main hall) and we were surprised. It was fairly clean, good looking with all the appliences you need (even microwave, fridge and safe). Big TV, 45 channels We were recently in the other hotels in Orlando and paid like $70-80 for one night and they did not look better So we were happy being there and you cannot beat the price really. But as other people says they have crappy rooms so you should ask or tip for one (I did not tip but asked if they had a room in the front building) Also I am attaching some pictures

Reviews.Title: “Good value and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: samsonitedc
Reviews.Content: I wanted to just add ot the other comments as well as relate my own experience. Reading the other reviews, i insisted on getting a room in the main building by the pool and i have to say it turned out to be pretty good. We got a great deal at bookit.com and u have to expect a resort fee at any hotel in this area. For the money we paid (<30) I think this hotel was really worth it. We had a good time in the city and we even spent one day in the hotel almost a day. The toilets were clean and the staff was evry helpful to any request that we made. the enw owners seem to be very hard working and sincere. Free wireless internet and printer helped us get great deals to wheerever we needed to go.

HotelInfo.Name: Howard Johnson Inn Tropical Palms Kissimmee
HotelInfo.Address: 4311 W Vine St/IrloBronson Hwy, US Hwy 192 & Bass Rd., Kissimmee, FL 34746
